description.narrative:
Insatsen avser ett kärnstöd till GAP för perioden 2016-2018. GAP är en civilsamhällesorganisation som grundades 2007 i Kosovo. GAPs vision är att bygga ett demokratiskt samhälle som garanterar individuell, politisk och ekonomisk frihet for alla dess medlemmar. Organisationen arbetar för att uppnå detta genom två program: 1.) God samhällsstyrning (good governance), inom vilket organisationen bedriver påverkansarbete samt bevakar och informerar om offentliga institutioners arbete och 2.) Utvecklingspolicier, inom vilket GAP bedriver forskning och erbjuder policyrekommendationer för offentliga styrdokument och lagar.
Inom programmet god samhällsstyrning finns ett flertal pågående projekt som berör bland annat bevakning av kommunalpolitik, uppföljning av landets statsbudget, bevakning och publicering av regeringsbeslut, och information om banksektorn. Inom programmet för utvecklingspolicier pågår projekt som berör energisektorn, privatsektorutveckling, effektivitet i statliga företag, samt vägtransport, säkerhet och miljö.

This contribution is a core support to GAP Institute for advanced studies (GAP) 2016-2018. GAP is a non-governmental organisation, established in Kosovo in 2007. GAP's vision is to build a democratic society that guarantees individual, political and economic freedom for all its members. In order to reach this vision the organisation works with two programmes: 1.) Good governance, which includes advocacy and monitoring of public institutions, and 2.) Development Policies, which includes policy research and recommendations pertaining to public policies and laws.
Within the programme for Good governance there are a number of on-going projects covering amongst others: monitoring municipalities; scrutinising the state budget; monitoring and communicating on governmental decisions; and, comparisons and information regarding the banking sector. Within the programme for Development Policies there are currently projects in the following areas: the energy sector, private sector development, effectiveness of public enterprises and car/road traffic policies.

tag.narrative: 10.3 - Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard.

10.3 - Säkerställa lika möjligheter och minska förekomsten av ojämlika utfall, bland annat genom att avskaffa diskriminerande lagstiftning, politik och praxis och främja lagstiftning, politik och åtgärder av lämpligt slag i detta hänseende.
16.5 - Substantially reduce corruption and bribery in all their forms.
16.5 - Väsentligt minska alla former av korruption och mutor.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.
5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer

description.narrative: GAP has continued to play an important role as one of the most trusted think tanks and sources of information in Kosovan society. It plays the traditional role of a civil society organisation as a watchdog of elected leaders, but in a well informed and professional way and in that way gaining respect in several layers of society. This approach has made GAP a source of information for political parties and other decision makers and the organisation has been invited to take part in both reference and monitoring groups for drafting and/or implementing governmental strategies at local level. GAP has continued to follow up municipal budgeting, scrutinizing how all Kosovan municipalities use their allocated funds, thereby providing transparency and knowledge to the public. The initiative is appreciated at ministerial level and GAP's web based budgetary platform (the web page containing information on how municipalities spend their budgets) is linked to most municipalities web sites through an agreement with the Ministry of Local Government Administration. Also on local level, GAP has continued its work on following up on promises made by municipal mayors in the election campaign in 2017. The findings are often cited in local media. These initiatives focusing on local level are very much in line with the prioritized shift of the Embassy to move from central to local level. GAP also continuously produces analytical reports on current issues such as the 100% import tax on goods from Serbia. The material is normally produced in three languages and assessed to be of high quality.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
